channel.title: Manasi Jayakumar, M.Phil. on Manasi Jayakumar
channel.description: Recent content in Manasi Jayakumar, M.Phil. on Manasi Jayakumar

item.title: Evidence of Effective Teaching
item.description: Contents: Summary of Course Evaluations Sample Mid-Course Survey Testimonials from Students Teaching Observations in Courses Workshop Evaluations Summary of Course Evaluations Course evaluations in the Department of Psychology at Columbia University use a 5-point scale. Students are asked to rate the overall teaching effectiveness of the instructor on a scale of 1 to 5 (1 = Poor, 2 = Fair, 3 = Good, 4 = Very Good, 5 = Excellent).

item.title: Fellowships and Teaching Development
item.description: Fellowships GSAS Teaching Scholar 2023-2024 Appointed as the Teaching Scholar for the Department of Psychology Instructor of Record for seminar course in Fall 2023 titled “From lab to life: How cognition research affects everything you do!” Fellowship covers sixth year funding (stipend, tuition, and fees) Lead Teaching Fellow 2022-2023 Organized a workshop for the department’s graduate students and post-docs titled “Agency as a TA: Building relationships with our students and creating inclusive learning environments”.

item.title: Mentorship
item.description: Research Mentees 2022-present: Cecilia Nemeth, Undergraduate Research Assistant, Columbia University 2021-present: Aria Tsegai-Moore, Post-baccalaureate scholar, Columbia University 2021-2023: Moe Khine, Undergraduate Research Assistant, Columbia University 2019-2022: Chinmayi Balusu, Undergraduate Research Assistant, Columbia University Mentee presentations Nemeth, C.º, Jayakumar, M., Tsegai-Moore, A.⁺, Aly, M. (2022, October) How do attentional fluctuations during encoding influence memory? Poster presented at the Columbia Undergraduate Research Symposium, New York, NY.

item.title: Research
item.description: My current research focuses on how naturalistic fluctuations in attention can be characterized and how these fluctuations in attention influence the temporal organization of memory. Publications Jayakumar, M., Balusu, C., Aly, M. (2023). Attentional fluctuations and the temporal organization of memory. Cognition, 235, 105408. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.cognition.2023.105408. [PDF]. [PsyArXiv]. [OSF]. [self-contained Code Ocean computing enviornment]. Trelle, A. N., Carr, V. A., Wilson, E. N., Swarovski, M. S., Hunt, M. P., Toueg, T.

item.title: Teaching Experience
item.description: Contents: Courses at Columbia University Workshops at Columbia University Prior Teaching Experience Courses at Columbia University How-To’s of Research Co-Instructor, Spring 2023 30-student intermediate psychology course, in-person Updated the pre-existing curriculum Designed and instructed classes as part of a teaching team Created content matter slide decks, assessments, and in-class activities Provided feedback on scaffolded assignments, and graded assessments Average effectiveness rating of 4.
